item.title: Solar power in space: Vanguard 1
item.description: Today is an interesting anniversary: the sixtieth anniversary of solar power in space. On 17 March 1958, the American satellite Vanguard 1 entered orbit, becoming the fourth satellite ever to do so, and the first to use solar power. Vanguard 1 was small enough to be held by a person in one hand – 1.5 kg (3 lbs) in mass and 16 cm (6”) in diameter, or 76 cm (30”) wide including the antenna aerials.
